page.title: 01DORNOCH & AREA GAZETTEER
page.content: {GENERAL INFORMATION:} Dornoch is a small town just east of the A9 and is situated near the sea. Its sandy beaches, historic buildings and world class golf course attracts many tourists. Dornoch is one of the three largest towns in the district. The cathedral in the town is the only one in the area. Dornoch has four main hotels which cater for tourists and golfers and also many guest houses as well as two caravan sites. Dornoch has one school which has a Primary School and a two year Secondary School. Much of the employment is in the service areas. The pace of life in the area is slow, and change is gradual. A newly proposed bridge across the Dornoch Firth could bring improvements in employment, tourism and easier access to Ross-Shire and Inverness. It could also mean a new railway for Dornoch.
